p: After DNA extraction with commercially available columns following the instructions of the manufacturer (Qiagen), B19V DNA in samples identified as positive in the screening assay was tested by a quantitative real time PCR (qPCR). The procedure used a set of primers targeting a fragment of NS1 region from nucleotide 2082 through 2274 on GenBank AF162273, as described elsewere [ 26] and, as a reference, the international standard WHO/NIBSC UK EN63QG 1st International Standard 2000 Parvovirus B19 DNA 500,000 IU/ml (code 99/800). The qPCR assay was performed with TaqMan probes essentially as cited [ 26]. A linear range of quantification was established between 1 × 10 3 and 2 × 10 6 IU/ml of B19V DNA (results expressed IU as recommended [ 27]) in ABI PRISM 7500 (Applied Biosystems) equipment. The sensitivity (95% detection limit) of this qPCR assay was approximately 100 IU/ml. Each sample was tested in triplicate.
